children: Diagnosis is based on clinical and radiographic findings, absence of exposure to substances or drugs that can cause interstitial lung disease, and negative evaluation for rheumatologic disease.

Lung transplantation may improve survival and quality of life. Pirfenidone and nintedanib have demonstrated benefit in slowing disease progression for select persons. Oxygen therapy is indicated for patients with hypoxemia.
Do not intubate and mechanically ventilate patients with respiratory failure caused by IPF.
